subject: Art & Design
title: Film Festivals: Where Art Meets Industry
description: A short lesson to help you apply Film Festivals: Where Art Meets Industry.

hook.text: The Palme d'Or at Cannes can turn an unknown filmmaker into a legend overnight. Festivals are cinema's kingmakers.

buildup.text: Film festivals serve as marketplaces where distributors buy films, critics build hype, and careers are launched.

twist.text: Sundance was created because Hollywood ignored independent voices. Now Hollywood scouts Sundance for its next franchise.

climax.text: Parasite won the Palme d'Or at Cannes in 2019, then swept the Oscars â€” the first non-English film to win Best Picture.

punchline.text: Festivals don't just screen films. They decide which films matter.

quiz.question: Why are film festivals important to the industry?
options: They serve as marketplaces for distribution deals and launch careers
They are primarily tourist attractions for host cities
They only screen films that already have distribution
